head.title: Accident Snarls Traffic On Bridge in Rush Hour

hedline.hl1: Accident Snarls Traffic On Bridge in Rush Hour

abstract.p: New Jersey-bound car overturns on George Washington Bridge, closing three of four lanes during morning rush hour; driver, Ernesto H Felize-Rodriguez is accused of drunken driving and passenger Juan Nunez suffers serious head injuries (S)

block.p: A New Jersey-bound car overturned on the upper level of the George Washington Bridge about 5:20 a.m. yesterday, closing three of four New Jersey-bound lanes until 10:50 a.m., the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey said.

A New Jersey-bound car overturned on the upper level of the George Washington Bridge about 5:20 a.m. yesterday, closing three of four New Jersey-bound lanes until 10:50 a.m., the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey said.

The car was not removed immediately because the crash was classified as a crime, said John L. Higgins of the Bergen County prosecutor's office. The driver, Ernesto H. Felize-Rodrigues, 19, of Hackensack, was accused of drunken driving and faces more charges because one of his passengers, Juan Nunez, also of Hackensack, suffered serious head injuries, Mr. Higgins said. The driver and another passenger were not injured.
